events.name: Italy blocks Chinese company from taking over Pirelli
events.wd_label: Italy blocks Chinese company from taking over Pirelli
events.wd_description: Italy has moved to block a Chinese state-owned company from taking over Pirelli, a renowned tire-making industry, as part of measures to protect Pirelli's independence.
events.description: Italy has moved to block a Chinese state-owned company from taking over Pirelli, a renowned tire-making industry, as part of measures to protect Pirelli's independence.

events.name: Italian government ruling
events.wd_description: The Italian government ruled that only Camfin, a company controlled by Pirelli’s boss Marco Tronchetti Provera, has the authority to nominate candidates for its chief executive.
events.description: The Italian government ruled that only Camfin, a company controlled by Pirelli’s boss Marco Tronchetti Provera, has the authority to nominate candidates for its chief executive.

events.name: Examination under Golden Power Procedure
events.wd_description: The agreement was examined by the administration of the Italian Prime Minister under the Golden Power Procedure rules, which aim to protect businesses deemed strategically important to the nation.
events.description: The agreement was examined by the administration of the Italian Prime Minister under the Golden Power Procedure rules, which aim to protect businesses deemed strategically important to the nation.

events.name: Pirelli's ownership history
events.wd_description: Pirelli was sold for €7.1bn ($7.8bn) in 2015 to a group of investors, including ChemChina and Camfin. ChemChina later merged with state-owned Sinochem.
events.description: Pirelli was sold for €7.1bn ($7.8bn) in 2015 to a group of investors, including ChemChina and Camfin. ChemChina later merged with state-owned Sinochem.

events.name: Global Temperatures Surge to Record Highs in June 2023
events.wd_label: Global Temperatures Surge to Record Highs in June 2023
events.wd_description: Global temperatures reached record highs in June 2023, with average temperatures 1°C higher than historical averages for the month, signaling an intensifying climate crisis that may make this year the warmest on record.
events.description: Global temperatures reached record highs in June 2023, with average temperatures 1°C higher than historical averages for the month, signaling an intensifying climate crisis that may make this year the warmest on record.

events.name: Record-High Global Temperatures
events.wd_description: Global average temperatures in June 2023 are approximately 1°C higher than those recorded for the same month since 1979, continuing a trend of intensifying global warming that could make this year the warmest on record.
events.description: Global average temperatures in June 2023 are approximately 1°C higher than those recorded for the same month since 1979, continuing a trend of intensifying global warming that could make this year the warmest on record.

events.name: Impact of Heatwaves and Wildfires
events.wd_description: The surge in global temperatures has led to catastrophic heatwaves in regions from Puerto Rico to Siberia, and massive wildfires in Canada have caused hazardous smoke conditions in cities like New York and Washington.
events.description: The surge in global temperatures has led to catastrophic heatwaves in regions from Puerto Rico to Siberia, and massive wildfires in Canada have caused hazardous smoke conditions in cities like New York and Washington.

events.name: Unprecedented Ocean Warming
events.wd_description: June 2023 also marked the second consecutive month of record-high ocean surface temperatures, contributing to overall global temperature rise, affecting marine life, coral reefs, and causing sea level rise.
events.description: June 2023 also marked the second consecutive month of record-high ocean surface temperatures, contributing to overall global temperature rise, affecting marine life, coral reefs, and causing sea level rise.

events.name: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_label: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.
events.description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.

events.name: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_label: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.
events.description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.

events.name: Smoke Pollution in the Midwest
events.wd_description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.
events.description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.

events.name: Warnings and Public Health Precautions
events.wd_description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.
events.description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.

events.name: GM and POSCO Future M's Ultium CAM joint venture expansion
events.wd_label: GM and POSCO Future M's Ultium CAM joint venture expansion
events.wd_description: General Motors and South Korean chemical company POSCO Future M announced the second phase of their Ultium CAM joint venture by investing over $1 billion in the North American market to increase CAM production capacity and integrate pCAM production.
events.description: General Motors and South Korean chemical company POSCO Future M announced the second phase of their Ultium CAM joint venture by investing over $1 billion in the North American market to increase CAM production capacity and integrate pCAM production.

events.name: Investment details
events.wd_description: The investment will increase CAM production capacity and integrate pCAM production into the Ultium CAM joint venture.
events.description: The investment will increase CAM production capacity and integrate pCAM production into the Ultium CAM joint venture.

events.name: Joint venture site
events.wd_description: A site for the joint venture CAM and pCAM complex will be announced at a later date.
events.description: A site for the joint venture CAM and pCAM complex will be announced at a later date.

events.name: GM's EV capacity plans
events.wd_description: GM plans to install 1 million units of annual EV capacity in North America by 2025, supported by four U.S. battery cell joint venture plants initially offering 160 GWh of capacity.
events.description: GM plans to install 1 million units of annual EV capacity in North America by 2025, supported by four U.S. battery cell joint venture plants initially offering 160 GWh of capacity.

events.name: Ultium CAM project's impact
events.wd_description: The Ultium CAM project is expected to support the production of roughly 360,000 Chevrolet, Cadillac, GMC, Buick, and BrightDrop vehicles each year in North America between 2025 and 2030.
events.description: The Ultium CAM project is expected to support the production of roughly 360,000 Chevrolet, Cadillac, GMC, Buick, and BrightDrop vehicles each year in North America between 2025 and 2030.

events.name: Statement from GM executive
events.wd_description: Doug Parks, GM’s executive vice president of Global Product Development, Purchasing and Supply Chain, emphasized the significance of increasing CAM production capacity and adding pCAM to the joint venture for building a secure and sustainable North America-focused supply chain.
events.description: Doug Parks, GM’s executive vice president of Global Product Development, Purchasing and Supply Chain, emphasized the significance of increasing CAM production capacity and adding pCAM to the joint venture for building a secure and sustainable North America-focused supply chain.

events.name: GM's battery manufacturing improvements
events.wd_description: GM has been working to improve battery manufacturing capabilities in North America, including teaming up with Samsung SDI to launch a new battery cell manufacturing plant in the U.S. by 2026.
events.description: GM has been working to improve battery manufacturing capabilities in North America, including teaming up with Samsung SDI to launch a new battery cell manufacturing plant in the U.S. by 2026.
